physical_examinations.relevant_findings: 4 x 8-cm soft-tissue mass, nontender to palpation without associated skin changes; range of motion lacking 10° to 15° of both flexion and abduction compared with contralateral shoulder; discomfort at extremes of motion; pain with resisted active motion; motor and sensory examinations indicate no deficit; pulses strong.
Mild shoulder pain and swelling; radiographs showed calcific densities within the superior portion of the glenohumeral joint.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicated recurrence compared to prior findings.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Recurrence confirmed on magnetic resonance imaging.
Appreciable limitations of motion in all planes; imaging studies showed a large mass (11.4 x 10 x 7.2 cm) in the shoulder area.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressively decreased shoulder motion compared to previous exams.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Multiple foci of recurrence about shoulder; evidence of bone erosion.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Rapid recurrence noted compared to previous findings.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Recurrent nontender mass over anterior aspect of right shoulder; fine-needle aspiration demonstrated malignant cells.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Loss of nearly all active motion of the right shoulder noted since previous evaluations.
